intro: Tibouchina benthamiana var. punicea, commonly known as the pink tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring glossy, lance-shaped leaves and a compact growth habit. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds, contributing to its ecological value.
